Posts.Content: Originally Posted by GeorgeS Thanks everyone, we never know how much 'mileage' we will get out of a treatment but we are hopeful for many more years to come! G. Good news George. It is good too, to have it posted here to know there is some good news now and again. Too, as you well know, it is what you do with the mileage, not so much the mileage... but good going for you and yours! doug
Posts.Signature: MyJourney: August 2004 Colonoscopy Clear June-July 2013 Abdominal Discomfort Upper Abdomen X-ray, UltraSound, CTScan all clear 8.23.13 Diagnosed 5cm tumor on rectum wall: adenocarcinoma @age 66 Aug-Sept2013 Met with Surgeon,Hematologist and Radiation oncologist Oct.-Nov.: Xeloda concurrent with radiation: 25 doses November CTScan, MRI and surgeon scoped: Tumor gone, scar tissue 1.6.14 Surgery LAR: Rectum removed, sphincter remains: Pathology: no lymph node, Tumor downgraded from Possible T3 to T2 Feb. - April Chemo:5 FU and Oxilaplatin:6 infusions over 14 weeks 9.4.14 ColonoscopyClear,CT Clear Dec.14 Follow up BlWk +,CEA .9 Mar.15Follow up BlWk +,CEA .6 June.15 Follow up BlWk +,CEA .7 Sept2015Followup BlWk + CEA .7 CTScanClear NED Dec2015SurgicalHerniaRepair Sept2016Followup BlWk + CEA .7 CTScanClear NED Sept-Oct2017Followup All clear NED Sept-Oct2018CTScan+Clear Bldwk+ Mar2019Bldwk+NED Continue ColoRectal Support Group monthly

Posts.Title: Crossed over into the "normal" zone...

Posts.Content: PCD, welcome to the forum, the place you don't want to be, but it is the place for you to learn about your father's condition and to get support, and to vent if necessary. Chuck is a super moderator, and especially knowledgeable about PC. I think he's right to suggest another person going with you since your father's English might not catch all you will hear. I know it is difficult to hear anything beyond the first words, "you have cancer." So, think about that. It is fabulous he has you there with him. Given Chuck's reply, I think there is good possibility for containment of the cancer. Be sure to keep your father active and well nourished as you move along in this experience. Good luck and keep us posted. Come back and ask your questions. There is good advice available here. doug

Posts.Signature: MyJourney: August 2004 Colonoscopy Clear June-July 2013 Abdominal Discomfort Upper Abdomen X-ray, UltraSound, CTScan all clear 8.23.13 Diagnosed 5cm tumor on rectum wall: adenocarcinoma @age 66 Aug-Sept2013 Met with Surgeon,Hematologist and Radiation oncologist Oct.-Nov.: Xeloda concurrent with radiation: 25 doses November CTScan, MRI and surgeon scoped: Tumor gone, scar tissue 1.6.14 Surgery LAR: Rectum removed, sphincter remains: Pathology: no lymph node, Tumor downgraded from Possible T3 to T2 Feb. - April Chemo:5 FU and Oxilaplatin:6 infusions over 14 weeks 9.4.14 ColonoscopyClear,CT Clear Dec.14 Follow up BlWk +,CEA .9 Mar.15Follow up BlWk +,CEA .6 June.15 Follow up BlWk +,CEA .7 Sept2015Followup BlWk + CEA .7 CTScanClear NED Dec2015SurgicalHerniaRepair Sept2016Followup BlWk + CEA .7 CTScanClear NED Sept-Oct2017Followup All clear NED Sept-Oct2018CTScan+Clear Bldwk+ Mar2019Bldwk+NED Continue ColoRectal Support Group monthly
Posts.Title: My father just got diagnosed, Dallas/FTW area

Posts.Content: Brahms, sorry you have found yourself here, there is lots to learn following a diagnosis. This site has a lot of people who will help you. Providing some information about yourself can help as well. I don't know much about Prostrate Cancer, yet, but I am confident others will weigh in here to offer what they can. This is a very good site to be on, only if you have to be. Keep posting as things progress. Good luck. d

Posts.Title: Radiation begins in 2 days!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Pratoman My wife goes shopping and asks me what i want her to buy, and i tell her i have no f'n clue. Right with you here, Pratoman I want to be "good," but what is left?? I agree with the assessment, not much new here, and similarly to other correlational research, it is correlation, not cause and effect, yes, we look for the correlations and push for 90% effects or 95% but always, there are exceptions. Seems too we need to look at the exceptions, why can some people "eat what they want, smoke what they want" and avoid cancer? Seems unique, and worth looking at. Mean time, yes, keep paying attention, moderation seems a good approach! Appreciate the post and posts

Posts.Title: WHO report on red meat

Posts.Content: Cheers back at you, Wilde. Enjoy your evening. Seems there's such a deep meaning to life for sure. Celebrating my grandson's sixth birthday tomorrow. doug Originally Posted by Wilde It is Friday afternoon in Sweden and I will soon fire up the barbecue and make some chicken and Italian sausages for me and Wife. Accompanied by a nice Italian red Ripasso wine. And after 7 months life feels quite good. Every morning I log in here and check your posts and try to contribute and it just hit me that you guys are a part of my everyday life now. So I just want to say Cheers my friends, I lift my glass to all of you and wish you a nice weekend.

Posts.Title: WHO report on red meat

Posts.Content: MZ, sorry you find yourself here, but you are in the right place to ask your questions. Lots of people posting here who have knowledge about your symptoms. They won't diagnose, but can steer you in the right direction. I know that the PSA test, while important, can give false positives for many varied reasons. Others here will offer more direction, I am sure. I hope all works out well for you. Be sure to come back and let us know how things go. d

Posts.Title: Still in the Zero Club

Posts.Content: RLT, Thanks for posting the good news here. Sometimes people don't come back to say how things have gone. Too, being a 67 year old male, I am interested in this prostrate stuff, as I see it, it's an issue of "when, not if." Go live the good life! d

Posts.Title: Since everyone here is so positive...I can use some of that today...

Posts.Content: Tom, not being a member of the PC club, but know cancer up close and personal, I too, want to offer my hope you aren't destined to become a member. However, know that should the follow up exams bring you here, be sure to come back. This is the place to be and the members of this forum know what they are talking about. One other tip. Try to stay away from Dr. Google and check the Forum's "stickies" on the PC Threads, they have the info you will need. Too, don't hesitate to post your questions here. Lots of good advice for you here. d
